Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler criticized the uneven grass coverage and a loose sandy make-up at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala, suggesting it could compromise the integrity of the game.
Afghanistan spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman nearly suffered a nasty injury due to the outfield conditions during a previous match at the same venue.
The International Cricket Council rated the outfield as 'average' and match referee Javagal Srinath was satisfied after a fresh inspection.
England had two training days at the venue and were unimpressed by the conditions, which they felt fell short of international norms.
Jos Buttler expressed concerns about players having to hold themselves back due to the poor outfield conditions.
Ben Stokes is unlikely to feature in the match as he continues to recover from a hip injury.
England is likely to include left-arm quick Reece Topley in their starting XI to add an extra specialist seam option.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eoin Morgan, in his role as an ICC World Cup ambassador, emphasized Ben Stokes' importance to the England team, highlighting his influence and contributions both on and off the field.
